Back to Franz Liszt

Franz Liszt

Venezia e Napoli, S. 159

1840 · LW A53 · R. 10d

[IMSLP]

Total duration: 23'

  • 1.
  • 2.
  • 3.
  • 4. Tarantelles napolitaines

This work exists in an earlier version from 1840 (S. 159; LW A53; R. 10d) and a later version from 1859 (S. 162; LW A197; R. 10c).

Liszt published the later version as a supplement to Années de pèlerinage, Deuxième année (Italie) (S. 161; LW A55; R. 10b).

S. 159/S. 162/
1–2–
31
–2
43

Recommended editions

  • New Liszt Edition (Editio Musica Budapest) · I/7 · Z. A/B 6785 · Années de Pèlerinage II · ed. Imre Mező / Imre Sulyok

1.

Liszt later used this theme in the symphonic poem Tasso: Lamento e Trionfo (S. 96; R. 413; LW G2), which he also arranged for two pianos (S. 636; LW C10; R. 358) and piano duet (S. 590; LW B20; R. 316).

Duration: 8'

Difficulty: 4.5

2.

Duration: 2' 30"

Difficulty: 3.5

3.

This piece is based on a theme by a Cavaliere Peruchini.

Duration: 3' 30"

Difficulty: 4.5

4. Tarantelles napolitaines

This piece is based on themes by Guillaume Louis Cottrau.

Duration: 9'

Difficulty: 4.5
